alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 10 at 3:17PM MDT until May 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE, AND LAL 6 ACROSS THE EAST... ...RED FLAG WARNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS EASTWARD DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEYS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Critical to extreme fire weather conditions are expected to continue until late evening for all zones. A very unstable airmass will continue to produce isolated dry thunderstorms over northwest and west central areas this afternoon, and scattered to isolated dry thunderstorms from the Sangre de Cristo Mountains southeastward to around Portales and Clovis. After a Pacific cold front crosses from the west tonight, strong northwest winds and very low humidities will return to most locations Thursday causing fire weather concerns to linger. The greatest confidence for widespread and long duration critical fire weather conditions on Thursday will be from the Sandia and Manzano Mountains eastward. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101, Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), from 11 AM to 10 PM MDT Wednesday and from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to 50 or 55 mph on today, then west and northwest winds at 20 to 30 mph with gusts from 40 to 50 mph on Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent each afternoon, except up to 20 percent near the Colorado border on Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
